metadata.name: ExtractJob
metadata.description:
ExtractJob

A {Job} subclass representing an export operation that may be performed on a {Table}. A ExtractJob instance is created when you call {Table#extract}.

metadata.name: destinations
metadata.description: The URI or URIs representing the Google Cloud Storage files to which the data is exported.

metadata.name: source
metadata.description: The table from which the data is exported. This is the table upon which {Table#extract} was called. Returns a {Table} instance.

metadata.name: compression?
metadata.description: Checks if the export operation compresses the data using gzip. The default is false.

metadata.name: json?
metadata.description: Checks if the destination format for the data is newline-delimited JSON. The default is false.

metadata.name: csv?
metadata.description: Checks if the destination format for the data is CSV. Tables with nested or repeated fields cannot be exported as CSV. The default is true.

metadata.name: avro?
metadata.description: Checks if the destination format for the data is Avro. The default is false.

metadata.name: delimiter
metadata.description: The symbol the operation uses to delimit fields in the exported data. The default is a comma (,).

metadata.name: print_header?
metadata.description: Checks if the exported data contains a header row. The default is true.

metadata.name: destinations_file_counts
metadata.description: The count of files per destination URI or URI pattern specified in {#destinations}. Returns an Array of values in the same order as the URI patterns.

metadata.name: destinations_counts
metadata.description: The count of files per destination URI or URI pattern specified in {#destinations}. Returns a Hash with the URI patterns as keys and the counts as values.
